intro: Casearia bonairensis, commonly known as the Bonaire casearia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Bonaire. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
